de.mrapp.android.util

Class ElevationUtilTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • AndroidTestCase
      • de.mrapp.android.util.ElevationUtilTest

  • public class ElevationUtilTest
extends AndroidTestCase
    Tests the functionality of the class ElevationUtil.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void testCreateElevationShadowWithBottomLeftOrientationAndNonParallelLight()
      Tests the functionality of the method, which allows to create the shadow of an elevated view, if the orientation is BOTTOM_LEFT and no parallel light is emulated.
      void testCreateElevationShadowWithBottomLeftOrientationAndParallelLight()
      Tests the functionality of the method, which allows to create the shadow of an elevated view, if the orientation is BOTTOM_LEFT and parallel light is emulated.

      Tests the functionality of the method, which allows to create the shadow of an elevated view, if the orientation is LEFT and no parallel light is emulated.
      void testCreateElevationShadowWithLeftOrientationAndParallelLight()
      Tests the functionality of the method, which allows to create the shadow of an elevated view, if the orientation is LEFT and parallel light is emulated.
      void testCreateElevationShadowWithNonParallelLightThrowsExceptionWhenContextIsNull()
      Ensures, that a NullPointerException is thrown by the method, which allows to create the shadow of an elevated view without emulating parallel light, if the context is null.
      void testCreateElevationShadowWithNonParallelLightThrowsExceptionWhenElevationIsGreaterThanMaxElevation()
      Ensures, that a IllegalArgumentException is thrown by the method, which allows to create the shadow of an elevated view without emulating parallel light, if the elevation is greater than the constant MAX_ELEVATION.
      void testCreateElevationShadowWithNonParallelLightThrowsExceptionWhenElevationIsLessThan0()
      Ensures, that a IllegalArgumentException is thrown by the method, which allows to create the shadow of an elevated view without emulating parallel light, if the elevation is less than 1.

      Ensures, that a NullPointerException is thrown by the method, which allows to create the shadow of an elevated view without emulating parallel light, if the orientation is null.
